body:
Yeah, this is a bug. You can work around it by setting the required space to zero, thus disabling the check.

(Syncthing does continue where it left off, but the free space check doesn't know that we already have the temp file. It's probably somewhat difficult to get this right in the general case...)
Sorry @calmh. Setting it to 0 didnâ€™t prevent the error. Had to delete again and restart. :(
The check is completely disabled when the required space is set to zero, but it may require a restart for that setting to "take". (It should say so in the GUI as well in that case)
Oh! Sorry. It is _not_ disabled in this specific case. It should be. That's a separate issue.

issue.title: Disk space check for individual files should not be enforced when the user has disabled it

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
As noted in #2598. Setting the required percentage to zero disables the percentage check. But we also check for each file that there is space for the temp file. But if the temp file already exists this can fail. We should either skip if the temp file already exists or, at the very least, skip the check if the required space is set to zero.

(Apart from this scenario, there may be valid cases where the disk space check just plain doesn't give accurate results and we should let the user override it.)

body: Darn. Anything else I can do as a workaround?
Use 0.12.9 released tomorrow, with the threshold set to zero.

issue.title: Refactor rwfolder tests

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
While trying to add tests to the space issue on #2598, I noticed these could be refactored a bit.
This creates a few utility functions to avoid repetition and removes some redundant checks.
